abstract: In a move to shed an unprofitable business as its turnaround gains traction, Intel said Tuesday it would join with STMicroelectronics, a Swiss semiconductor maker, to form a new company to sell flash memory chips. Flash memory is used in cellphones, digital music players and digital cameras and is considered one of the most erratic segments of the semiconductor market.
lead_paragraph: In a move to shed an unprofitable business as its turnaround gains traction, Intel said Tuesday it would join with STMicroelectronics, a Swiss semiconductor maker, to form a new company to sell flash memory chips. Flash memory is used in cellphones, digital music players and digital cameras and is considered one of the most erratic segments of the semiconductor market.

headline.main: Intel to Form a Flash-Memory Venture
